subject: Programming
title: ALGOL and Language Design
description: A fast breakdown of ALGOL and Language Design for builders.

hook.text: In 1960, European and American scientists wanted one universal programming language.

buildup.text: They created ALGOL, designed by committee to be the gold standard of language design.

discovery.text: ALGOL introduced code blocks, nested functions, and formal grammar rules still used today.

twist.text: Almost nobody programmed in ALGOL. Its ideas were more influential than its adoption.

climax.text: C, Java, and Python all inherited ALGOL's block structure without crediting it.

punchline.text: The language nobody used shaped every language.

quiz.question: What did ALGOL introduce that modern languages still use?
